main.name: Eric Chen
main.description: Here you'll learn about what I do, what I've done, and what I am interested in doing.
main.bio: I am currently a software developer at Amazon. I am passionate about the intersection between artificial intelligence, machine learning, and data science. In my free time I like to play basketball and ocassionally watch TV or sports as well as watch anime.
main.contactmessage: Here is where you should write your message to readers to have them get in contact with you.

resume.skillmessage: Here are some of the software and technologies I have been using and my experience in each skill.

education.degree: Masters of Engineering in Computer Science
Bachelor's of Science in Computer Science
classes: CS 4780: Machine Learning for Intelligent Systems

work.title: Software Development Engineer
work.description: I am working on a team in AWS Managed Services, which is a service family under AWS that manages customer accounts and changes done in their accounts through various services that we developed. Read more at https://aws.amazon.com/managed-services/

work.title: Teaching Assistant
work.description: I am a teaching assistant for data structures and OOP, differential equations, machine learning, artificial intelligence, and computer organization. For the differential equations class, I prepared worksheets and lectures for students in the class and met biweekly with other facilitators to learn and train about active learning techniques. For the other classes, I helped grade homework and exams for respective class and held office hours to help students understand the material.

work.title: Software Engineer Intern
work.description: Developed the "Chaos Proxy" application, which simulated network latencies and outages experienced by network requests to the various mock services used by the application during high load Performance testing (Similar to the Chaos Monkey Project - Netflix). Created a UI dashboard to allow performance testers to configure various mock services using ReactJS and Bootstrap. The server side proxy application was developed using Spring Boot. Application was built and deployed as a standalone war file on Apache Tomcat.

work.title: Software Engineering Intern
work.description: Used Python Flask web framework to connect Postgresql to Python through ORM and Graphql. Then wrote Python script to create nodes and relationships for company models in Neo4j graph database.

work.title: Software Engineering Intern
work.description: Used data intelligence platform powered by Splunk to search, analyze, and visualize big data. Wrote Python code and regex to format Android log files and index them into Splunk for analysis. Then developed Python modules to analyze Android HMI tickets by important attributes such as Priority and Date and generate reports for tickets without log files.

testimonials.text: Here you should write some nice things that someone has said about you. No lies though, employers can tell when you are lying.

That Tim Baker must be one of the most brilliant developers I've ever met! It is amazing that nobody has hired him yet. Hey you, you should hire this guy, he may be fresh out of University and have zero on the job experience but I am confident that he will be one of your best developers in no time!
